I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Hypotheses:

x: nat

Goal:
x < y -> power x 2 ⇣ power y 2 = 0

Premises:
Notation power := (mscal mul 1)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
nat_meet_mult_power2 : forall q x y : nat, x * power q 2 ⇣ (y * power q 2) = x ⇣ y * power q 2
nat_meet_euclid_power_2 : forall q r1 d1 r2 d2 : nat, r1 < power q 2 -> r2 < power q 2 -> (r1 + d1 * power q 2) ⇣ (r2 + d2 * power q 2) = r1 ⇣ r2 + d1 ⇣ d2 * power q 2
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> power p x < power q x
nat_meet_euclid_2 : forall r1 d1 r2 d2 : nat, r1 < 2 -> r2 < 2 -> (r1 + 2 * d1) ⇣ (r2 + 2 * d2) = r1 ⇣ r2 + 2 * (d1 ⇣ d2)
nat_lb_length : forall x n : nat, x < power n 2 -> length ⟬ x ⟭ <= n
sum_2_power_2_injective : forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, j1 <= i1 -> j2 <= i2 -> power i1 2 + power j1 2 = power i2 2 + power j2 2 -> i1 = i2 /\ j1 = j2
power_2_inj : forall i j : nat, power i 2 = power j 2 -> i = j
power2_gt_0 : forall n : nat, 0 < power n 2
rel_iter.rel_iter_bound = fun (R : nat -> nat -> Prop) (k n x y : nat) => exists q c : nat, x * power n (S k) < q /\ rel_iter.is_seq R c q n /\ rel_iter.is_digit c q 0 x /\ rel_iter.is_digit c q n y : (nat -> nat -> Prop) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_iter.rel_iter_bound _%function_scope (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
power_decomp_factor : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, 0 < i < S n -> f 0 < f i) -> ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => a (S i) * power (f (S i) - f 0 - 1) p) * power (S (f 0)) p + a 0 * power (f 0) p
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> power k p < power (S k) p
rel_iter.is_digit = fun c q i y : nat => y < q /\ (exists a b : nat, c = (a * q + y) * power i q + b /\ b < power i q) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_iter.is_digit (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
nat_euclid_pow2_lb : forall n r q : nat, r < power n 2 -> ⟬ r + q * power n 2 ⟭ ≂ ⟬ r ⟭ ↑ lb_shift n ⟬ q ⟭
nat_meet_dio : forall a b c : nat, a = b ⇣ c < -> (exists x y : nat, b = a + x /\ c = a + y /\ a ≲ a + x /\ a ≲ a + y /\ x ≲ x + y)
power_of_0 : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> power n 0 = 0
power_0 : forall x : nat, power 0 x = 1
rel_iter.is_digit_fun : forall c q i x y : nat, rel_iter.is_digit c q i x -> rel_iter.is_digit c q i y -> x = y
scal_one : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (k : nat) (x : X), mscal sum zero k x = times (mscal sum zero k one) x
scal_one_comm : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (k : nat) (x : X), times (mscal sum zero k one) x = times x (mscal sum zero k one)
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
binomial_Newton : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : X), times a b = times b a -> mscal times one n (sum a b) = msum sum zero (S n) (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero (binomial.binomial n i) (times (mscal times one (n - i) a) (mscal times one i b)))
lb_ortho_plus_join : forall x y : lb, x ⟂ y -> x ⊕ y ≂ x ↑ y
Nat.Proper_instance_0 = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => conj (fun H1 : x <= x0 => Nat.Private_Tac.not_gt_le (fun H2 : y0 < y => (fun H3 : x <= y0 => (fun H4 : y <= y0 => (fun H5 : y < y => Nat.Private_Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Nat.Private_Tac.le_lt_trans H4 H2)) (Nat.Private_Tac.eq_le (Nat.Private_Tac.eq_sym H) H3)) (Nat.Private_Tac.le_eq H1 H0))) (fun H1 : y <= y0 => Nat.Private_Tac.not_gt_le (fun H2 : x0 < x => (fun H3 : y0 < x => (fun H4 : y0 < y => (fun H5 : y < y => Nat.Private_Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Nat.Private_Tac.le_lt_trans H1 H4)) (Nat.Private_Tac.lt_eq H3 H)) (Nat.Private...
times_zero_l : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall x : X, times zero x = zero
lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric = lb_mask_equiv_sym : Symmetric lb_mask_equiv Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> y ⪯ x /\ x ⪯ y Arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric [x y]
lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive = lb_mask_equiv_trans : Transitive lb_mask_equiv Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive : forall [x y z : lb], x ≂ y -> y ≂ z -> x ⪯ z /\ z ⪯ x Arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive [x y z]
mscal_comm : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> m (mscal m u n x) y = m y (mscal m u n x)
binomial_lt_power : forall n i : nat, binomial.binomial n i < power (S n) 2
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
scal_times : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> forall (k : nat) (x y : X), mscal sum zero k (times x y) = times x (mscal sum zero k y)
equal_lb_mask_equiv : forall x y : nat, x = y < -> ⟬ x ⟭ ≂ ⟬ y ⟭
times_zero_r : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> forall x : X, times x zero = zero
power_S : forall n x : nat, power (S n) x = x * power n x
mult_2_eq_plus : forall x : nat, x + x = 2 * x
power_mono_l : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x
power_mono : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x
power_0_inv : forall p n : nat, power p n = 0 < -> n = 0 /\ 0 < p
mscal_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> mscal m u n (m x y) = m (mscal m u n x) (mscal m u n y)
lb_nat = fix lb_nat (l : lb) : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => bool2nat x + 2 * lb_nat l0 end : lb -> nat Arguments lb_nat _%list_scope
power_decomp_unique : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a b : nat -> nat), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> a i < p) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> b i < p) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => b i * power (f i) p) -> forall i : nat, i < n -> a i = b i
```intros. intros H_lt. unfold power. rewrite nat_meet_mult_power2. rewrite mult_2_eq_plus. specialize (power_sinc y 2). intro H_sinc. apply H_sinc. auto.```
